properties.title: SVN Access & bug tracking
properties.abstract: Outlines how to access the SVN repository.

section.title: Issue Reporting and Tracking - JIRA
section.p: Please use JIRA for reporting any issue and tracking their progress. In addition, Jira offers many additonal (more sophisticated) features that allow you to keep in touch with the project's current progress.
Before submitting issues, please read 'How to submit an issue'.

section.title: SVN access
section.p: To get the latest, most up-to-date source code, you'll need to use SVN. Please see the section on anonymous SVN access below. If you wish to simply browse the SVN for specific files or to view changes and commit logs use FishEye access to the SVN repository.
Or as an alternative, please download the full source distribution for a given release.

section.title: Anonymous SVN Access
section.p: The source code, documentation and libraries are available for anonymous access from the Codehaus SVN server.

section.title: Behind A Firewall?
section.p: Sometimes firewalls are configured in such a way that the ports used by SVN are blocked, and thus users behind the firewall cannot access the SVN repository. If you fall into this category, there's some alternatives outlined below.
